alert.note: Alert for Marfa Plateau; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN JEFF DAVIS AND SOUTHWESTERN CULBERSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1015 PM CDT... At 923 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Green River, or 11 miles south of Van Horn, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Van Horn, Lobo, and Culberson County Airport. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 137 and 152. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Marfa Plateau; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
